description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh with elements of taʻlīq, in black ink with use of red for headings and re-inking. Beige paper with irregular laid lines visible. A few marginal annotations by another hand. Several inscriptions on the pastedown of the upper cover. According to the colophon, copied from the author's autograph in Mashhad al-Sharīf al-Kāẓimī al-Jawādī, on ...? Dhū al-Qaʻdah 723 [Nov. 1323] by Aḥmad ibn [... (Mach-Ormsby read "Zayn al-Dīn")] ibn al-Ḥaddād (colophon, fol. 95b). Collation: Paper, fol. 95 ; 1¹⁰ (-1, before fol. 1) 2-8¹⁰ 9⁸ 10¹⁰(-2, after fol. 95) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "al-Thālithah" (see fol. 20a). Incipit: الحمد لله ذي القدرة القاهرة والعزّة الباهرة ... امّا بعد فانّ الله تعالى كمّل الانسان بقدر ... وخصّه بالعقل والنطق باللسان Explicit: واما المخالفون فى الفروع كالمسايل الشرعيّة فهم خاطيون غير فسقى بالاجماع فهذا آخر ما كتبناه والحمد لله رب العالمين وصلّى الله على سيدالمرسلين محمد النبى وآله الطاهرين الاخيار
author: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325
abstract: Careful copy of a commentary on al-Yāqūt by Abū Isḥāq Ibrāhīm ibn Nawbakht, on Shīʻī kalām.
extent: 95 leaves : paper ; 245 x 130 (180 x 80) mm. bound to 245 x 135 mm.
